13:40.race_name: Fairlight Studios Conditional Jockeys' Handicap Chase (Go North Monet's Garden Series Qualifier)

runners.comment: Record of 2-5 since wearing cheekpieces; still unexposed over fences; respected
runners.name: Rehill Relic
runners.spotlight: Record of 2-5 since wearing cheekpieces, the wins over hurdles at Sedgefield (2m4f, good) last April and over fences at Huntingdon (2m4f, good to soft) latest start; may show further improvement in this sphere; respected in the retained headgear.

runners.comment: His form at Sedgefield this season has received a few boosts; enters calculations
runners.name: Largy Train
runners.spotlight: Very lightly raced since completing a hat-trick as a novice chaser two seasons ago; his Sedgefield form (2m5f) this season has received a few boosts, and latest effort suggests this drop back in trip may prove ideal; enters calculations.

runners.comment: Solid record at about 2m since switched to chasing; likely player if sustaining the form
runners.name: Dixie Cowboy
runners.spotlight: Solid record (122) at about 2m since switched to chasing, the win and the latest effort at Sedgefield (soft/good to soft); may still be capable of further progress at this level; likely player, provided he's as effective back up in distance.

runners.comment: In the process of showing best chase form when hampered and unseating rider last time
runners.name: The Jewellers Pet
runners.spotlight: Both hurdles wins at Ayr (2m4f); was in the process of showing best chase form when hampered and unseating rider soon after two out there (2m) last time; could go well off a handy mark, provided he takes to Sedgefield (first run here).

runners.comment: Currently in a consistent vein of form; scored at Sedgefield on penultimate start
runners.name: Huit Reflets
runners.spotlight: Currently in a consistent vein of form; opened his chase account in Sedgefield contest (2m, good to soft) on Boxing Day, beating Dixie Cowboy and taking record here to 3321; ran creditably at Catterick (2m3f) since; solid claims.

runners.comment: Veteran who remains on a long losing spell; 5lb out of weights
runners.name: Cudgel
runners.spotlight: Not disgraced at Hexham in sole start this term; however, this 13yo remains on a long losing spell and understandably isn't quite the force of old; having such a low current mark means he's 5lb out of the weights in this field.

14:10.race_name: Happy Birthday Rebecca Mares' Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)

runners.breeder: Dr V Roger-Yves Simon Et Al
runners.comment: Form dipped in Listed grade most recently but she commands respect back down in class
runners.name: La Zoubida
runners.spotlight: Record of 1-3 in bumpers and 2-3 over hurdles; ran a long way below market expectations (third favourite) in Listed grade at Haydock most recently but warrants respect, even with a big penalty, back down in grade; gained one of her wins over C&D (soft).

runners.comment: About 4l behind Rosie Baloo last time but is in good hands and still open to progress
runners.name: Laffer Curve
runners.spotlight: Thrice-raced mare who made the frame at Wetherby (2m3f, soft) switched to hurdles most recently; finished about 4l behind Rosie Baloo in that contest but may make the rematch tighter, being in excellent hands and still open to progress.

runners.comment: Unexposed but is stoutly bred and may ideally need a stiffer test of stamina
runners.name: Rosa Diaz
runners.spotlight: Raced only twice, namely an Irish point success in 2024 and staying-on fifth in Ludlow novice hurdle (2m5f, good to soft) last month; unexposed but is stoutly bred and may not flourish under rules until presented with thorough tests of stamina.

runners.comment: Building up a solid record; beat all bar the market leader at Wetherby most recently
runners.name: Rosie Baloo
runners.spotlight: Building up a solid record, having won her sole bumper start and shown consistency in maiden hurdles, beating all bar the market leader at Wetherby (2m3f, soft) most recently; sibling to four jumps winners for her connections and looks on her way to following suit.

runners.comment: Ordinary maiden on Flat; unseated rider early on hurdles debut
runners.name: Melosa
runners.spotlight: Ordinary maiden on Flat; unseated rider early when the rank outsider in Doncaster juvenile hurdle for new yard; the least appealing contender.

14:40.race_name: Fairlight Studio Happy New Year Novices' Handicap Hurdle

runners.comment: Interesting, with progress plausible now handicapping and back down in trip
runners.name: My My My Delilah
runners.spotlight: Solid record in bumpers; produced her best hurdles RPR in race won by highly notable rival; seemed a non-stayer over 2m5f last time; interesting, with progress plausible now handicapping and back down in trip.

runners.comment: Justified market support at Newcastle on reappearance and may show further improvement
runners.name: Kazar Forez
runners.spotlight: Ex-French 6yo who justified market support at Newcastle (2m1f, good to soft) on reappearance and only third British attempt, opening his account; may build on that win and show further improvement at an ordinary level; respected.

runners.breeder: Irish National Stud Mare Syndicate III
runners.comment: Modest effort over C&D in sole outing this term (stable debut, 50-1 shot)
runners.name: Saviour
runners.spotlight: Record of 0-6 on Flat and 0-5 over hurdles; modest effort over C&D in sole outing this term (stable debut, 50-1 shot); perhaps best watched unless the market signals prove stronger.

runners.comment: Still a maiden but is being given a chance by the assessor; not dismissed
runners.name: Expelliarmus
runners.spotlight: Ex-Irish maiden; has failed to improve this term for new stable but is being given a chance by the assessor, having dropped a total of a stone in the weights; may step up on her Newcastle effort behind Kazar Forez.

runners.comment: May be capable of a bigger effort back down in distance on second handicap start
runners.name: The Coffey Boy
runners.spotlight: Irish point winner who has raced exclusively at Ayr in four rules attempts, weakening in 19-runner handicap over 2m4f most recently; may be capable of a bigger effort in this smaller field back down in distance.

runners.comment: Handicap debutant who is far from solid on form and may be quirky
runners.name: Delayed Charm
runners.spotlight: Handicap debutant who is far from solid on form and may be a quirky sort, having decided to run out approaching the final flight in Carlisle event when last seen (detached at the time).

runners.comment: Meager RPRs over hurdles; 8lb out of the weights; opposed
runners.name: Macho Sun
runners.spotlight: Overall record is 0-24; has recorded meagre RPRs over hurdles and is held by Kazar Forez on Newcastle running two starts ago; 8lb out of the weights and easily opposed.

15:10.race_name: Paxtons No1 Caseih Dealer Handicap Hurdle (Go North Sea Pigeon Series Qualifier)

runners.breeder: Mrs A L Merry & Mr Brett Merry
runners.comment: Consistent; gets hardly any respite from the assessor but is likely to give her running
runners.name: Fromheretoeternity
runners.spotlight: Consistent form for current yard includes three wins last term; gets hardly any respite from the assessor and is lumbered with top weight on return from seven-month layoff; however, again seems likely to give her running, which makes her solid.

runners.comment: Record of 212 since switched back to hurdles from chasing; again likely to go well
runners.name: Chase A Fortune
runners.spotlight: Record of 212 since switched back to hurdles from chasing, the win at Wetherby (2m, soft) in first-time cheekpieces; Musselburgh effort (1m7f, good to soft) last time resulted in a career-best RPR; should go well in the retained headgear.

runners.comment: Folded tamely when last seen but has steadily progressive form otherwise over hurdles
runners.name: Celestial Reign
runners.spotlight: Folded tamely when last seen five months ago but has steadily progressive form otherwise over hurdles, including a Sedgefield maiden win, and may still have more to offer under this code; goes handicapping with Joshua Thompson taking off a handy 7lb.

runners.comment: Looks well treated if a resurgence materialises, being 7lb below last winning mark
runners.name: Russian Virtue
runners.spotlight: On a long losing spell and form figures of 246 this term reflect that a turnaround of sorts is required; admittedly appears well treated if that resurgence materialises, being 7lb below last winning mark.

runners.breeder: Airlie Stud & Mrs S M Rogers
runners.comment: Two from two in juvenile hurdles; still open to progress and stable is in blinding form
runners.name: Indian River
runners.spotlight: Showed promise in a couple of Flat maidens in Ireland; has justified favouritism in juvenile hurdles at Catterick (1m7f, good; by a head) and Wetherby (2m, soft; by half a length) for new trainer, who is currently in blinding form; still open to progress and commands respect.

runners.breeder: A OBrienM Al Monsour& K Al Attiyah
runners.comment: On long losing spell but this second run since wind surgery may be the time to catch him
runners.name: Ghasham
runners.spotlight: On a long losing spell but this second run since having wind surgery may be the time to catch him; currently in reasonable form anyway, having produced a record of 2634 since joining Dan Skelton, and the return of cheekpieces looks a plus; shortlisted.

runners.comment: Still needs to prove he retains peak ability but market support should be noted
runners.name: Inca Prince
runners.owner: R Whitelock L Clemitson & R Jefferson
runners.spotlight: No win since his juvenile campaign; long absence prior to two efforts this term, seeming to need July run then faring better in October; still needs to prove he retains peak ability but market support should be noted.

15:40.race_name: Michael & Fred Watson Handicap Chase (Go North Red Rum Series Qualifier)

runners.comment: Course specialist who ran well in defeat over 2m3f here last month; tries a new trip today
runners.name: Tom Creen
runners.spotlight: Gained all five chase wins here (2m3f-2m5f, good to soft/soft); bounced back from low-key seasonal debut when second in higher-grade race here (2m3f, good to soft) last month and remains on a workable mark; big player if stamina holds out on this first venture beyond 3m1f.

runners.comment: Former pointer/hunter chase; well beaten on handicap debut but may have needed the run
runners.name: Slaney Opera
runners.spotlight: Former pointer who won maiden hunter chase at Kelso (2m7f, good) for owner-trainer last April and was placed in prestigious novices' hunter chase at Stratford (3m3f, good) the following month; soundly beaten on last month's stable/handicap debut but might have needed that outing and remains lightly raced under rules; interesting.

runners.comment: Badly out of form towards end of last year; cheekpieces added in bid to perk him up
runners.name: Similar Story
runners.spotlight: Now 2lb lower than when winning on chase debut at Kelso (2m7f, good to soft) in October 2024 but not much has gone to plan this season and he looked badly out of sorts at Catterick just after Christmas; cheekpieces added in bid to perk him up.

runners.comment: Creditable third of 14 at Catterick last month; slower ground a slight concern here
runners.name: Scottish King
runners.spotlight: Placed in two of his four chases this season, more recently when close third of 14 at Catterick (3m1f, good) last month; may not be as well suited by the slower ground here but still features prominently in calculations; sports first-time cheekpieces.

runners.comment: Place over 2m4f at Musselburgh last month but stamina for this trip not copper-bottomed
runners.name: Nights In Venice
runners.spotlight: Placed off reduced mark at Musselburgh (2m4f, good to soft) last month and another 1lb lower today but has modest 1-25 career strike-rate and his stamina for this trip is not copper-bottomed.

runners.comment: Safely held in both handicap hurdles; needs to improve on this switch to chasing
runners.name: Carrhill
runners.spotlight: 0-5 over hurdles, having been safely held in both handicaps (2m7f/2m4f); needs to improve for this switch to chasing but has plenty of pointing experience to call upon.

runners.comment: 2m5f course winner last month; held over 2m3f since but of interest over this new trip
runners.name: Uncle Al
runners.spotlight: Led close home to open account in first-time cheekpieces here (2m5f, soft) last month, his fourth start over fences; never really got competitive at Catterick (2m3f, good) three weeks later but could plausibly have untapped potential over this new trip.

runners.comment: Surprise winner in November but this inconsistent veteran has been well beaten twice since
runners.name: Eveque
runners.spotlight: Won over slightly longer trip here (soft) two years ago and rallied well to double chasing tally on seasonal debut at Hexham (3m, good to soft) in November; this inconsistent veteran was well beaten on his last two appearances and cheekpieces didn't appear to help much when tried once last season.

runners.comment: No threat to front pair when third on chasing debut but could still have potential
runners.name: Delgany Deadline
runners.spotlight: Unexposed 6yo who made the frame in both his handicap hurdles (3m/2m3f); no threat to front pair when keeping on for modest third on last month's chasing debut at Market Rasen (3m, good to soft) but moves up in trip and sports first-time cheekpieces here, and could still have potential.

runners.comment: Returned from long absence with two non-completions for new stable last month
runners.name: Aill Dubh
runners.spotlight: Ex-Irish 9yo who returned from long absence with two non-completions for new stable last month (1m7f/2m3f) and is now 0-10 under rules; tries a new trip here; others have much less to prove.

runners.breeder: Dr V Denis Hubert & Mr Eric Helye
runners.comment: Ran okay when fourth over C&D last month but now 0-24 under all codes; 9lb wrong today
runners.name: Iturgeon Du Breuil
runners.spotlight: 0-24 under all codes; gave fairly good account of himself when fourth over C&D (soft; beaten about 16l) last month but is effectively 4lb higher from further out of the weights today and needs subsequent wind operation to have made a difference.

16:10.race_name: Stockton RFC Womens & Girls Handicap Hurdle

runners.comment: Came good two starts ago and didn't really have race run to suit on latest outing
runners.name: Secret Vino
runners.spotlight: Came good over hurdles at fifth attempt, staying on well to lead on run-in at Southwell (2m, good to soft; unraced on slower) in November; not seen to quite the same effect in more tactical event at Market Rasen (2m2f, good to soft) on Boxing Day but promises to be suited by this longer trip and may still have more to offer.

runners.comment: Placed three times in a row towards end of 2025, most recently over C&D
runners.name: Livano Bello
runners.spotlight: 0-9 over hurdles but was placed three consecutive times towards end of last year, most recently when third (just behind Kaviar Wood) over C&D on Boxing Day (good to soft; also suited by soft); sometimes races a bit too freely but there's a very good chance he'll be on the premises again.

runners.comment: Safely held all three starts since causing 50-1 surprise on hurdle debut in spring 2024
runners.name: Nellie Bluesky
runners.spotlight: Caused 50-1 shock on hurdling debut at Perth (2m4f, good to soft) in May 2024 but safely held all three starts since; last month's handicap debut (2m2f) came after a one-year absence and she might come on for the run but others here have more pressing claims.

runners.comment: Ex-Irish maiden who was well beaten on both starts for new stable in the autumn
runners.name: Kates Choice
runners.spotlight: Ex-Irish maiden who was well beaten on both starts for new stable in the autumn (2m4f maiden/2m5f handicap); difficult to enthuse over.

runners.comment: Ran quite well in two chases for new stable this season; first hurdle run since early 2024
runners.name: Imperial Rule
runners.spotlight: Won three chases (one here) for Rebecca Menzies in 2024 and started off for Lizzie Quinlan with two very respectable chase runs this season; quite tricky to weigh up on first hurdling start for over two years and may not be favoured by rain but has a lower mark for this discipline.

runners.comment: 0-5 over hurdles but ran big race from the front when second over C&D on Boxing Day
runners.name: Kaviar Wood
runners.spotlight: 0-8 in points and 0-5 under rules but looked suited by the step up in trip and ran big race from the front when second over C&D (good to soft) on Boxing Day; obvious contender if in similar form again.

runners.comment: Ended last year in good form at about 2m; this trip on slow ground might stretch him
runners.name: National Question
runners.spotlight: Dual good-ground hurdle winner, latterly at Newcastle (2m1f) in October; runner-up on soft ground here (2m1f) on next outing and not discredited when fifth at Musselburgh last time but 2m4f on slow ground might stretch him.
